title: How to Carve a Watermelon Tea Pot

steps.headline: Using an oblong or round watermelon, slice off a piece approximately 1 ½ inches down on the stem end.
Cut the small, round cover handle out of the center of this piece by using a small round cookie cutter, or cut by hand.
steps.description: Place the remaining larger "ring" on the serving plate to act as a base and place the whole watermelon on top of it, cut side down.

steps.headline: Slice off approximately 4 inches (10.2 cm) from the other end of the watermelon and set aside.
steps.description: Scoop out the watermelon flesh using a melon baller, and set aside.

steps.headline: Slice the 4-inch thick watermelon piece in half, lengthwise, making two 2-inch round pieces.
steps.description: Use the round end piece for the Teapot cover. Make decorative cuts in the rind with a melon baller and fill holes with melon balls

steps.headline: Lay the remaining melon slice down and cut in half, making the handle and spout out of each half.
steps.description: Scoop out the red flesh. Make decorative cuts in the rind of the handle piece with a melon baller and fill with melon balls. You may need to trim the spout and handle pieces so they fit flat against the melon. Attach with sturdy, round toothpicks
